data.title: When I'm Downtown its El Portero!
data.text: Located on the corner of Saginaw and Court Street is a wonderful example of a Mexican restaurant, the decor is colorful and vibrant which sets the mood for having fun. It always seems to be very clean and the service is also very good. As for the food, I really enjoy there enchiladas, and they have a unique twist on their nachos,  with shredded chicken and cheese on top muy bien! If you are hungry and downtown Flint I highly recommend visiting El portero!

data.title: great Mexican food
data.text: Wonderful food.  My fave has peppers, pork and a great sauce!  Hubby likes the dish that has just about everything on it. Really good.

data.title: Good Food Good Drink
data.text: The food is good.  There are a couple dishes that you don't see on other Mexican food places.  The Margaritas are good and pack a bit of a punch.  All in all, a good experience.

data.title: Really????
data.text: We called in a take out order, and my husband stood and waited to cash out for 10 minutes as our food sat on the counter.  The gal was across the bar, filling water glasses and chatting to a customer, instead of getting us our food . When he mentioned the fact that he had been waiting for 10 minutes, she did not seem to care. The food was fair, but we didn't even get what we ordered.  They will probably be another flash in the pan at this location.

data.title: Pretty Good Tex Mex for Mi
data.text:
Being from Texas, our expectations may be higher than most. I don't ususally search out Mexican when we travel, so used to  what I get at home that it just isn't worth it to me.  My husband on the other hand, wants to try it every where we go! I haven't lived in the north for 40 years, but told him not to expect much. Wow...was I surprised! El Potrero easily matched some of our local Houston Tex Mex restaurants in taste and menu offerings. A far cry from what I remember available in Mi! We ordered Margaritas...a true test.  They were nicely frozen, with just the right proportions of lime and tequila. Actually liked them better than the ones at our local watering hole! The chips were good and plentiful. Many places actually charge for the chips ( never in Texas) but El Potrero did not, and kept the basket full.  The picante sauce tasted authentic, not mass produced, but it may have been. A nice blend of tomato and spices, but not overly spicey. I tried the sampler appetizer for my main course. This consisted of a Cheese Quesadia, flauta, chimichanga, guacamole, cheese dip (queso) and green salsa.This gave me an opportunity to sample the Mexican mainstay. Everything was very good, and more than enough food for two people. I could only eat one of each ( there were 2) item. The chimichanga was exceptional and the quesadia cheese was very creamy and cheesey not tough. My husband tried the Pollo Accupulco and a taco on the side. Everything was gone when he finished so I guess he enjoyed it.  We both thought the service was good, attentive to our empty glasses, and chip basket! The prices were very reasonable right at $30 for two  with Margaritas, about what we spend at home.  I have to eat my words, about Michigan and Mexican food, El Potrero has changed my mind, at least for this one resaturant.
I'll go back and try something else, if I'm in town.

data.title: Great food at a great price!
data.text: My wife and I love this place! Very consistant service and food. Great atmosphere too. If you are looking for aurhentic cusine look no further. This is a must for mexican food.

data.title: Great little restaurant!
data.text: small place, but lots of seating, have both booths and table and chairs.  Salsa and chips are served, a bit on the spicy side but really good!  Had a few dishes I haven't seen before on a typical Mexican menu.  They have a childrens menu, lunch is served till 3pm.  Lots of parking North of the building, and also West of the building.

data.title: Good food and decent service
data.text: If you like Mexican food, their food is good, and the service is decent. Their chile dishes are very good. Everything else is tasty and average.

data.title: El Potrero - Best Mexican Restaurant
data.text: El Potrero is the best Mexican I've ever had.  The food is real authentic Mexican, unlike Don Pablos or any chain Mexican.  The food and service are consistently excellent.  The price is really reasonable as well.  They have a few locations in Flint.  If you haven't been, go tonight.  You will get hooked.  Try the white cheese sauce for the tortilla chips.

data.title: The BEST Mexican in Flint!
data.text: If you are looking for good Mexican fare at a good price, El Potrero is it!  They are locally owned and actually have parking, unlike most of downtown. The staff is super friendly and the portions won't leave you hungry.   I recommend!

data.title: A Taste of Mexico in Downtown Flint
data.text: This fairly new addition to downtown dining serves delicious Mexican food at surprisingly low prices. Everything is fresh and of good quality. Drinks are available. The decorating is festive and the service is fast, friendly and very attentive.  They also do a brisk take-out business.

data.title: Best Mexican in Flint
data.text: This place was packed so that's a good sign.  I got some dish that was a combination of meat strips with peppers, onions and topped with cheese.  It was delicious!  The salsa is great (ask for both kinds).  One has cilantro and one is spicy.  Mix the two for a great flavored salsa.  If you're not into Mexican, I wouldn't suggest coming here.  My cousin and aunt got the steak and they almost couldn't eat it.

data.title: The new Downtown Location
data.text:
There is a new location of El Potrero in downtown Flint.   Bailiwick Pub used to be at this location.

The mexican food is pretty good, and there are several lunch specials right around $5.  This is the closest restaurant to Flint's City Hall and the old courthouse.   Just like the Fenton Road location, you get a lot of food for your money.  Even the cheapest lunch special, the "Speedy Gonzalas", will satisfy.
